dcterms:creator: Edward Lorenz
dcterms:description: The multiscale Lorenz96 equation is a chaotic, coupled, multiscale PDE that serves as a model for atmospheric dynamics, demonstrating the influence of small-scale dynamics on large-scale behavior.
dcterms:title: Multiscale Lorenz96

dcterms:creator: Ambrish Pandey
Janet D. Scheel
Jörg Schumacher
dcterms:description: Rayleigh-Bénard Convection is a model for turbulent, chaotic convection flows, applicable in fluid dynamics and atmospheric dynamics.
dcterms:title: Rayleigh-Bénard Convection

dcterms:description: The Johns Hopkins Turbulence Database provides a comprehensive collection of turbulence data for research and analysis.

dcterms:description: Weatherbench is a benchmark dataset designed for data-driven weather forecasting, providing a standardized framework for evaluating forecasting models.
dcterms:title: Weatherbench

dcterms:creator: Kendal McGuffie
Ann Henderson-Sellers
dcterms:description: Climatology provides foundational knowledge and methodologies for climate modeling, serving as a primer for understanding climate systems.
